BRO, Albin Carl (br6), educator; b. Prentice, Wise., Sept, 4, 1893;
s Peter John and Karolina (Anderson)B.; A.B., Northland Coll,, 1917,
Litt®D., 1941; Student Coll, of Missions, Indianapolis, Ind., 1917-19s
U» of Nanking, China, 1919-20, U. of Chicago, 1925-27; m.
Marguerite Harmon, May 28, 1918; children—Harmon Hartzell,
Kenneth Arthur, Alice Karen, Andrew Harmon. Ednl. missionary,
China, 1919-25; instr. and field worker, Northland Colic 1927-29;
sec. Religious Edn« Assn., 1929-31; with Pension Bd., Disciples
of Christ, 1931-32; with U. of Chicago Press, 1932=39;
pres. Frances Shimer College, Mt. Carroll, Ill., 1939-^95
cultural officer to Am. Embassy, S0oul, Korea, Jan.-June, 1950;
cultural officer U. S. Embassy, Indonesia since 1950. Mem. Religious
E&gu Assn. Baptist*. Club: Quadrangle (U of Chicago).
Address: care U. S. Embassy, Bjokarta, Indonesia.
WHO8 S WHO - Volume 27, page 1741
MORRIS, Delyte W(esley), univ. pres.: b. Xenia, Ill., Apr. 11, 1907;
s. Charles Cue and Lillie Mae (Brown; M.; A.B0, Park Coll., 1928;
student East Central State Teachers Coll., Okla., summer 1929;
A.M., U. of Maine, 1934; Ph.D., U. of la., 1936$ m* Dorothy Arnold Mayo,
Dec. 18, 1930; children—Peter Craig, Michael Alan, Teacher high scho.
Sulphur, Okla., 1928-30; instr. pub. speaking, and dir. forensic
activities, univ. of Maine, 1930~36; chum, speech dept. Jr. Coll.,
Kansas City, Mo., 1936-38; churn, speech dept, and dir. spl. edn. clinics,
Indiana State Teachers Coll., Terre Haute, Ind., 1938=46; prof,
speech and dir. speech and hearing clinic, Ohio State U., 194^-48;
pres. Southern Ill. U. since 1948. Mem. Am, Speech and Hearing
Assn. (pres. 1949. see.-treas. 1941-48), and Ind. Teachers Speech
Assn.(pres'. 1943-44), Central States Assn Teachers of Speech (pres.
1946*47)9 Intemat. Council for Exceptional Children, Ill. Edn. Assno,
Speech Assn, of Am., Nat. Edn. Assn., Southern Ill. Hist. Soc., Nat.
Confo Social Work, A.A.A.S., Am. Coll. Personnel Assn., Am. Assno
Seho Adminstrs., State Nat. History Div0, Bd. of Natural Resources,
Ill. Good Rds. Assn. (dir.). Ill. Fulbright Comap,State March of Dimes
Com., Greater Egypt Assn., Southern Ill.,Inc., Carbondale C. of C.5
Crab Orchard Field Trial Club, Sigma Pi Sigma, Phi Delta Kappa,
Pi Kappa Delta. Methodist. Mason (Shriner). Elk. Lion. Contbr.
articles to prof, jours. Home: 1006 S. Thompson St., Carbondale, Ill.

WYNN^ Earl (Raymond), ednl. adminstr.; bora Coal Valley * Ill.,
Nov. 25, 1911; s. Z?4oc Hardin and Mary Jane (Ziegler) W.; A.B.,
Augustam Coll., 1932; H.S., Northwestern, 1934, post grad.,
1936-38; m. Irene Grace Schwartzinger, Sept. 8, 1939- Asst. prof.
English and speech, charge speech div. Tarkb (Mo.) Coll., 1934=36;
asst, and instr. speech. Northwestern, summers 1934=38, full time,
1936-38; instr. dramatic art, U. of N.C., 1938-40, asst. prof,
dramatic art, in charge of radio, 1940-43; produced and directed
Men in Action from U. of N.C., campus for MBS coast-to-coast network,
1941-42; dir. communication center (developed idea of center and
organized same, 1945-46) since 1946, head dept, of radio (established
dept.) since 1947; exec. dir. N.C. Communications Study Ccmmn.,
